item.title: Apple to announce $100B further commitment for U.S. manufacturing
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: This is on top of Apple's previously announced plan to invest $500 billion into the U.S. over the next four years.

item.title: Instagram takes on Snapchat with new ‘Instagram Map’
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Instagram notes that location sharing is off by default on Instagram Map, and a user's location only updates when they open the app, meaning it doesn't provide real-time location updates.

item.title: Tinder explores a redesign, dating ‘modes,’ and college-specific features to boost engagement
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Tinder will redesign and debut college specific features, like searching for people within the college, to appeal to younger users.

item.title: Cohere’s new AI agent platform, North, promises to keep enterprise data secure
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Canadian AI firm Cohere is taking aim at alleviating data privacy concerns with its new AI agent platform, North, which can be deployed privately so that enterprises and governments can keep their, and customers', data safe behind their own firewalls.

item.title: Two arrested for smuggling AI chips to China; Nvidia says no to kill switches
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) said on Tuesday that two Chinese nationals have been arrested for their alleged involvement in illegally shipping "tens of millions of dollars" worth of high-performance AI chips to China.

item.title: Photo-sharing app Locket is banking on a new celebrity-focused feature to fuel its growth
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Celebrity Lockets is a new feature where celebrities can engage with their most loyal followers on their home screens.

item.title: Final call: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 ticket savings end tonight
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 marks 20 years of shaping the startup world — and tonight’s your last chance to save up to $675 on your ticket. From October 27–29, Disrupt returns to Moscone West in San Francisco. Join 10,000+ tech innovators, founders, VCs, and ecosystem builders for three days of high-impact programming, networking, and startup energy. […]

item.title: Microsoft brings OpenAI’s smallest open model to Windows users
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Microsoft will bring OpenAI's new free and open GPT model, gpt-oss-20b, to Windows 11 users via Windows AI Foundry, its platform that lets users tap AI features, APIs, and popular open-source models on their computers.

item.title: Google says hackers stole its customers’ data by breaching its Salesforce database
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Google confirmed that one of its cloud-stored Salesforce databases was breached, exposing its customer data. Google attributed the breach to a hacking group, ShinyHunters, known for breaking into Salesforce databases.

item.title: Qwant and Ecosia debut Staan, a European search index that aims to take on Big Tech
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: European search engines Qwant and Ecosia said on Wednesday that they have both started serving search queries through an index they developed together, Staan, that aims to be a cheaper, more privacy-focused alternative to Google and Bing.

item.title: Clay confirms it closed $100M round at $3.1B valuation
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The AI sales automation startup raised fresh funds, led by CapitalG, just months after its last round.

item.title: For the first time, OpenAI models are available on AWS
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: This is a juicy competitive move for both companies after AWS faced an onslaught of criticism over its progress with AI.

item.title: Linda Yaccarino joins health tech platform eMed as CEO after leaving X
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Though Yaccarino does not have experience in health tech, eMed said in a press release that they sought her out for her "undeniable ability to negotiate new partnerships."

item.title: Substack rival Ghost connects to the open social web with its latest public release
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: While the ActivityPub integration is a main selling point for Ghost 6, this major release includes a number of other changes and new additions.

item.title: OpenAI launches two ‘open’ AI reasoning models
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: For the first time in more than five years, OpenAI is launching a new open language model that appears to be state of the art.

item.title: Some people are defending Perplexity after Cloudflare ‘named and shamed’ it
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: In a debate likely to get louder as AI agent usage grows, some people say Perplexity crawling blocked websites isn't a simple matter.

item.title: The EU AI Act aims to create a level playing field for AI innovation: Here’s what it is
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: The European Union’s Artificial Intelligence Act, known as the EU AI Act, has been described as “the world's first comprehensive AI law” by the European Commission.

item.title: Google’s NotebookLM is now available to younger users as competition in the AI education space intensifies
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: The removal of age restrictions is intended to provide younger students with access to the AI research tool, allowing them to better understand their class materials.

item.title: WhatsApp adds new features to protect against scams
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The company announced that it took down over 6.8 million WhatsApp accounts linked to criminal scam centers targeting people around the world.

item.title: Three weeks after acquiring Windsurf, Cognition offers staff the exit door
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Cognition is also laying off 30 employees. Those who don't take the buyout are expected to work 80+ hour weeks.
